name: "skill" tag on learn.sparkfun.com
description: A wide variety of technical tutorials on various EE related skills.

name: Soldering is Easy
description: Comic book that goes over the basics of soldering that has been translated into quite a few languages.

name: Uses of Different Soldering Iron Tips
description: Covers what all those different soldering iron tips are good for.

name: All About Circuits
description: Online textbook for learning theory with clear diagrams and explanations.

name: Electrical Engineering
description: Khan Academy - Online learning platform with lots of topics, including a full course on electrical engineering, circuits, semiconductors, signals, robots, and even reverse engineering electronic devices.

name: LTSpice
description: The industry standard free SPICE circuit simulator from Linear Technologies.

name: Ngspice
description: Open source SPICE circuit simulator.

name: Circuit JS
description: Open source online simulator for simpler circuits with live interactivity and visualization.

name: Every Circuit
description: Free to try online, visual, interactive circuit simulator for simpler circuits.

name: Qucs
description: Open source integrated circuit simulator for DC, AC, S-parameter, noise analysis, etc.

name: iCircuit
description: Easy to use electronic circuit simulator, its advanced simulation engine can handle both analog and digital circuits and features realtime always-on analysis.

name: Tracespace Viewer
description: Gerber viewer that lets you inspect the individual layers as well as the board preview.

name: Gerblook
description: Online Gerber viewer powered by Gerbv.

name: Mayhew Labs 3dpcb
description: 3D Gerber viewer.

name: EasyEDA Gerber Viewer
description: Gerber viewer and design for manufacture test.

name: CircuitPeople
description: No frills 2D layer viewer for Gerbers, without the excessive processing.

name: Gerbv
description: Excellent Gerber viewer for Linux and BSD.

name: KiCAD Gerbview
description: The KiCAD gerber viewer.

name: KiCAD
description: Open source EDA package with push and shove router, differential pairs and much more.

name: Eagle
description: One of the most popular EDA packages due to it's (board size restricted) free version.

name: Design Spark PCB
description: Gratis EDA package without restrictions, sponserd by RS Components.

name: Altium Circuit Maker
description: Free package from the maker of the go to pro software.

name: gEDA
description: Another open source package, good for people that like scripting and makefiles, Linux and BSD only.

name: DipTrace
description: Quality Schematic Capture and PCB Design software with (pin and signal layer restricted) free version.

name: Xesscorp's list of KiCAD 3rd party tools
Contextual Electronics' Shine on You Crazy KiCad
description: Beginner video tutorial that gets you to a manufactured board as quickly as possible.

name: Contextual Electronics' Getting to Blinky Tutorial
description: A more comprehensive beginner to intermediate video tutorial.

name: KiCAD.info Forums
description: User discussion and help forum.

name: Keyboard PCB Guide
description: Comprehensive written tutorial that takes you through creating a keyboard PCB.

name: Cheatsheet (also in landscape)
description: Short PDF that goes over the menus and keyboard shortcuts for the most common operations.

name: Footprint Collection
description: Collection of all the KiCAD footprints available online and some scripts to manage them.

name: List of ULPs everyone should know
PCB Shopper
description: Comparison service for quite a lot of different PCB batching and assembly services.

name: OSH Park
description: Low cost PCB batching service with high quality boards with a signature purple silkscreen.

name: Aisler
description: Affordable quality circuit boards made in and shipped from Europe (Germany).

name: Dirty PCBs
description: Low cost PCB batching service that prides itself on its "dirty" quality.

name: Octopart
description: Probably the most well known part search engine.

name: Findchips
description: Part search from Supply Frame.

name: Parts.io
description: Another search engine from Supply Frame geared towards discovering new parts.

name: Buyparts.io
description: A new contender from the creator of the datasheetarchive.com. Is aimed at hobbyists and seems to be better at incorporating sources such as Ebay and Aliexpress.

name: Kitspace.org
description: Project sharing site that helps you buy parts and re-build projects. Open source and developed by yours truly.

name: Hackaday.io
description: Social site for sharing projects from the popular blog.

name: 1-click BOM
description: Browser extensions that automates purchasing and part searching.

name: Partsbox.io
description: Web service to manage your part inventory with a nice user interface and Octopart integration.

name: Partkeepr
description: Open source web service for managing your part inventory with parametric search and automatic datasheet import.

name: Part-DB
description: Another open source web service for managing part inventory with a permission system and a good barcode generator.

name: Eyrie.io
description: For viewing Eagle and KiCAD designs online.

name: SnapEDA.com
description: Parts library with free symbols & footprints. (Compatible with Eagle, KiCAD, Altium, OrCad, Allegro, etc.)

name: Sparkfun
description: Retailer and designer of open source electronics development boards and other equipment and materials with excellent accompanying tutorials.

name: Adafruit
description: Another retailer and designer with excellent selection and tutorials.

name: Tindie
description: Marketplace for electronics makers to sell low volume batches of their own designs.

name: Hackaday
description: Probably the most popular blog covering electronics and hardware hacking with a whole staff of writers.

name: bunniestudios.com
description: Andrew 'Bunnie' Huang covers hardware hacking, open hardware, manufacturing and more.

name: Bald Engineer
description: Project logs, tutorials and articles about electronics and embedded software by James Lewis.

name: Rheingold Heavy
description: More project logs, tutorials and articles about electronics and embedded software, these ones by Dan Hienzsch.

name: EEVBlog forum
description: Probably the largest and most active forum to discuss electronic engineering topics.

name: /r/electronics and /r/ECE are the two most active sub-reddits for EE topics.
/r/askelectronics
description: Sub-reddit dedicated to help on electronics topics.

name: Electronics Stack Exchange
description: Question and answer site for electronics running on the popular Stack Overflow service.

name: EEVBlog beginners forum
description: Good place for beginner questions, other sub-forums on EEVblog should be suitable for questions on more advanced topics.

name: The Amp Hour
description: Off-the-cuff chat about electronics with Chris Gammel and Dave Jones (EEVBlog), often with guests

name: Embedded FM
description: Christopher and Elecia White discuss embedded systems development and much more, often with guests.

name: Sparkgap Podcast
description: Covers a specific EE topic each episode, sometimes with guests.

name: MacroFab Engineering Podcast
description: Weekly podcast where Parker and Stephen from MacroFab discuss EE topics and industry news

name: The Engineering Commons Podcast
description: Covers general engineering topics from mechanical to electrical.

name: EEVblog
description: One of the earliest and most successful YouTube channels where Dave Jones does teardowns, tutorials and more.

name: ElectroBOOM
description: YouTube channel that debunks and explains EE topics with a lot of comedy thrown in.

name: Micah Scott
description: Video logs of reverse engineering and re-purposing consumer electronics hardware in creative ways.

name: Afrotechmods
description: Tutorials on electronics projects, often suitable for beginners as well.

name: The Signal Path
description: Very in depth teardowns, repairs and reviews of lab equipment and prototyping products.

name: w2aew
description: Excellent tutorials about basic and complex analog hardware.

name: Mr. Carlson's Lab
description: Teardowns, repairs and restorations with an emphasis on classic electronics gear.

name: GreatScott
description: Electronics tutorials, projects and how to's.

name: Julian Ilett
description: Buys cheapest electronic modules he can find and tries to do useful things with them.

name: MikesElectricStuff
description: Teardowns, large lighting projects, xrays and more.

name: Ben Eater
description: Series of videos on building an 8-bit computer on breadboards with excellent explanations of all the sub-circuits.

name: Boldport Club
description: Electronic projects for the curious. As a member of the Boldport Club you’ll receive an electronics project once a month.

name: AdaBox
description: Curated Adafruit products, unique collectibles, and exclusive discounts. All delivered quarterly.

name: PwnKitteh/InsanelyCheapElectronics
description: A list of cheap electronics from China, that you can use in your projects

name: PCB/EDA software list on the EEVblog forums
description: A much more comprehensive list of all the software tools available.

name: intajay/open-electronics
description: Another GitHub list: resources for Electronics Enthusiasts and Hardware Hackers

name: Vitorian/awesome-fpga
description: Awesome list of FPGA resources

name: cajt/list_of_robot_electronics
description: A GitHub list of resources, projects and products for robot electronics

name: embedded-boston/awesome-embedded-systems
description: Awesome list of embedded programming resources
